summary:
USER_CONTEXT: Fix Sphinx autodoc issue where type aliases are not applied when autodoc_typehints='description'

TASK_TRACKING:
COMPLETED: 
- Analyzed codebase structure and identified key files
- Located autodoc_type_aliases usage in sphinx/ext/autodoc/__init__.py (lines 1252, 1304, 1314, 1446, 1462, 1473)
- Found typehints.py file that handles 'description' mode
- Identified inspect.signature() function in sphinx/util/inspect.py accepts type_aliases parameter
- Discovered the root cause: record_typehints function in typehints.py calls inspect.signature(obj) without type_aliases parameter
- Examined existing test structure in test-ext-autodoc directory
- Analyzed how type aliases work with autodoc_type_aliases config
- **IMPLEMENTED FIX**: Modified line 30 in sphinx/ext/autodoc/typehints.py to pass type_aliases parameter

PENDING: 
- Run verification test to confirm fix works
- Run existing test suite to ensure no regressions

CODE_STATE: 
- Modified sphinx/ext/autodoc/typehints.py line 30
- Created test files: test_reproduction.py, simple_test.py, debug_type_aliases.py, proper_test.py, test_fix_verification.py

CHANGES: 
- Line 30 in typehints.py: `sig = inspect.signature(obj)` → `sig = inspect.signature(obj, type_aliases=app.config.autodoc_type_aliases)`

TESTS: 
- Created verification test script test_fix_verification.py (not yet executed)
- Analyzed existing test structure showing type alias behavior

DEPS: 
- sphinx.util.inspect module provides signature function with type_aliases support
- app.config.autodoc_type_aliases contains the configured type aliases
